On this tour, we'll explore those stories ‚Äî tales of ghosts, murder, spectres and s√©ances ‚Äî and see what they can teach us about the history of the school and the city that surrounds it. properties.title: Free Geek Toronto Open House
properties.description:
Are you passionate about sustainability, digital inclusion, or simply love tech? Don‚Äôt miss this opportunity to explore Free Geek Toronto‚Äôs impactful work in the heart of Toronto!

As a non-profit, tech reuse social enterprise, we‚Äôre on a mission to bridge the digital divide and reduce e-waste. We‚Äôre opening our doors to show you how we're accomplishing this.

Here‚Äôs what you can expect at our open house:

:wrench: Transforming tech
Get an inside look at how we refurbish old devices, giving them new life with secure data wipes, repairs, and open-source software. We‚Äôre not just fixing computers‚Äîwe‚Äôre creating affordable tech solutions for individuals and organizations in need.

:earth_africa: Sustainable solutions
 Discover how our eco-friendly tech programs are making a difference, from reducing e-waste to offering green solutions that support both local communities and the planet.

:bulb: Supporting digital inclusion
By partnering with local organizations, we provide low-cost technology and job training to communities facing barriers to tech access. Learn how you can help expand opportunities for those in need, while developing skills for yourself.

:seedling: Network with like-minded innovators
Whether you're a techie, an environmental advocate, or just someone looking to give back, you'll meet others who are eager to make a positive impact through technology.

We‚Äôre more than just a tech hub; we‚Äôre a community-driven force for good. Come see how we‚Äôre building a more inclusive, sustainable future‚Äîone 
computer at a time.

Join us at Free Geek Toronto‚Äôs Open House! Let‚Äôs build a greener, more inclusive digital world‚Äîtogether. :computer::recycle: See you there!

properties.title: Lunch & Learn: A Roundtable for First-Time Investors
properties.description:
Thinking about making your first tech investment? Join GSA Ventures for a relaxed and insightful lunch roundtable on May 8 at 11:00 AM, hosted at Global Startups HQ.

We‚Äôre gathering a small group of aspiring investors to explore what it really takes to spot early-stage companies with big potential ‚Äî often overlooked by mainstream capital. Our lens? Traction, grit, and real-world performance over hype.

In this two-hour session, we‚Äôll cover:

* How venture capital works at the earliest stages
* What syndicated funds are ‚Äî and how they fit into the investment landscape
* Lessons from nearly a decade supporting startups and writing our first cheque

If you‚Äôre looking to learn, connect, and explore the tech investment world without the jargon, this lunch is for you.

properties.title: MaRS Mornings: Frontiers of AI in Toronto‚Äôs Discovery District
properties.description:
‚ÄãVisit the epicentre of AI innovation ‚Äî Toronto's Discovery District ‚Äî where modern artificial intelligence was crafted by Nobel Laureate Geoffrey Hinton and continues to evolve through world-leading research and commercialization. 

‚Äã‚ÄãFrontiers of AI is a day of programming on June 25 delivered in partnership with MaRS, the University of Toronto (UofT) and Vector Institute, featuring a hands-on showcase of Canadian innovation that is shaping the global future of AI ‚Äî take part in engaging conversations, demos, workshops and networking. Meet emerging and established leaders in AI, alongside decision-makers in business and tech.

‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãLocated in the heart of Toronto's innovation corridor, this event brings together three powerhouse institutions that have helped establish Toronto as a world-leading AI hub: MaRS, the world's largest urban innovation hubs; the University of Toronto, home to pioneering AI breakthroughs that sparked the global AI revolution and The Vector Institute, renowned for bridging cutting-edge AI research with real-world applications across 32 enterprise partners and 200+ startups.

‚ÄãMaRS Mornings will take place from 10:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. at the MaRS Centre. Join us for:

‚ÄãPanel discussions on current developments and the long-term impacts of AI
‚ÄãSpecial focus on breakthrough applications in health, climate and emerging technologies

‚Äã‚ÄãThis event is open to:

‚Äã‚ÄãFounders and entrepreneurs in AI and deep tech
‚Äã‚ÄãCorporate innovation leaders and investors
‚Äã‚ÄãAI researchers and practitioners
‚Äã‚ÄãStudents and professionals interested in AI careers
‚Äã‚ÄãIndustry partners seeking AI collaboration opportunities

‚Äã‚ÄãWhy Toronto's Discovery District: Home to Nobel Prize-winning AI research, U of T and Vector Institute's globally renowned AI expertise, the MaRS Centre and a concentration of research hospitals and innovation centres all within a 5-block radius, the Discovery District represents the intersection of academic excellence, industry innovation, and startup dynamism that makes Toronto a unique global AI hub.

‚Äã‚ÄãEvent Access: Free, open to the public

Registration is required due to limited capacity

‚Äã‚ÄãJoin us in celebrating Toronto leading deep technology startups as well as its legacy as the birthplace of modern AI. Explore how our ecosystem continues to shape the future of technology and innovation globally.

properties.title: Business Intelligence in Action: Hands-on Microsoft Power BI Clinic
properties.description:
Join us for PRAKTIKAI‚Äôs first hands-on workshop with our Power BI Clinic. Open to practitioners in business intelligence of all skill levels, from beginners to seasoned users.

‚ÄãIn this 2-hour session, we‚Äôll introduce the essential features of Power BI and quickly move on to the theoretical backing for good data visualization and dashboard design and then go hands-on with to build a dashboard from scratch.

‚ÄãWe‚Äôll also have time allotted at the end of the workshop for Q&A and 1-1 work in the clinic portion. Come with questions or your own business intelligence questions and let us help you level up your Power BI skills.

‚ÄãAgenda:
‚Äãüé¨ Introduction & Overview (20 minutes): Background on Power BI, evolution of the platform, market positioning, core capabilities
‚Äãüìä Visualization Fundamentals (30 minutes): Learn about best practices for designing clear, effective, and informative visuals
‚Äã‚öíÔ∏è Power BI ‚Äì Hands-on (40 minutes): Step-by-step guidance on creating your own dashboard, from importing data to setting up measures and creating visualizations using an example industry dataset (30 minutes)
‚Äãü©∫ Q&A & Power BI Clinic (30 minutes): Clear your doubts and discuss challenges with us and other users, live and in-person. Apply what you've learned by working on a project of your choice or building on our example dashboard.

‚ÄãWho Should Attend:
- This workshop is suitable for practitioners of all skill levels, and even those completely new to Power BI wishing to learn:
- ‚ÄãBeginners in data and analytics wanting to get started with Power BI
- ‚ÄãIntermediate users looking to refine their skills and design best-in-class dashboards
- ‚ÄãProfessionals who manage or analyze data as part of their role

‚ÄãAbout the presenters:
You can learn more about PRAKTIKAI and your presenters here: https://www.praktikai.com/company

‚ÄãTechnical Requirements:
To join this workshop, attendees must have Power BI installed on their device. The workshop will be conducted entirely within the Power BI platform. You can download an install the latest version of Power BI here: microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/products/power-bi/downloads

‚ÄãContact Us: For any questions prior to the event, please reach out directly via the event form or at via email at contact at PRAKTIKAI dot com.

properties.title: COMMON CODE: How do we shift from ‚Äúalways on‚Äù to ‚Äúintentionally present‚Äù?
properties.description:
In a world designed to keep us constantly connected, what does it mean to truly be present? This conversation invites us to explore digital burnout, attention fatigue, and the possibilities of being fully here - with ourselves, each other, and our surroundings. Together, we‚Äôll reflect on how Toronto‚Äôs tech culture might help shape new norms around presence, pace, and pause. 

__

Five days. Five public spaces. Five big questions. 

Common Code is a free pop-up conversation series hosted by Reset that invites Toronto‚Äôs tech community to gather in public spaces to explore questions at the intersection of tech, trust, and togetherness in Toronto. Each day, we bring a new question to life in a different neighbourhood that invites Town Hall-like dialogue and debate on topics related to surveillance, sovereignty, safety and more. An unplug valet will be available at each pop-up for anyone wishing to go phone free.

properties.title: Super.com Toronto Tech Week Event
properties.description:
Join the engineering leadership team from Super.com who will present playbooks with step-by-step guidance on how we grew from series A to C. Participants will have a chance to hear from our CTO Ryan Fox presenting a playbook for org scaling and strategic investments as you scale. With additional playbook presentations on how to measure your engineering organization, build world class infra eng. and CI/CD tuned for the developer experience. We will also present playbooks for building engineering culture, delivering self serve experimentation, and how to identify the correct technical debt and investments as your product matures. 

The format of our presentations are designed to be practical and actionable so other engineering leaders and founders can learn from what helped us become a thriving and profitable scaleup. We have topics for engineering leaders and managers at all levels, infrastructure engineers and those interested in improving DX, experimentation, and more!  

Agenda:
-4:00PM - Super.com open house (doors open)

-5:00PM - Ryan Fox, CTO - A playbook for scaling your engineering org.
Description: You‚Äôve achieved product-market fit and you‚Äôre ready to scale. This playbook presentation will cover type and the sequencing of key strategic decisions related to org structure, technical investments, product lifecycle, and how to ensure you maintain technical excellence as you grow from 10 engineers to more than 100 that made Super.com successful.

-5:30PM - Matt Culver, Engineering Chief of Staff - How to measure an engineering org. 
Description: A data driven approach to measuring your growing tech company. A step by step playbook for picking measures that are meaningful to your org, and how to align incentives between your engineers and business by picking measures that improve developer experience.

-6:00PM - Nomaan Ahmed, Sr. Director Product Eng - Building empowered engineering culture. 
Description: Having a great company needs great culture. We will present a step by step playbook on how [Super.com](http://Super.com) built empowered engineering culture by focusing on empathy, maximizing team autonomy, and encouraging leadership from within teams by using guilds.

-6.30PM - Gage Sonntag, Sr Director Data Eng & Analytics - Self serve product experimentation and 10x the rate your teams can learn from and make product decisions.
Description: Using a robust experimentation framework at your company will improve the validity of your A/B testing outcomes and vastly increase the rate at which you can learn and optimize your product. Learn how Super.com delivers 2.5 experiments per person per quarter and does so with 90%+ developer satisfaction.

-7:00PM - Kyle Pericak, Director Infrastructure Eng - Building killer developer infrastructure, a playbook for becoming ‚Äúunbound‚Äù.
Description: Super.com‚Äôs journey towards building killer Developer Infrastructure and optimizing for cycle time. Learn how we provide fast and affordable per-developer dev/test environments, built trust in our automated test systems, implemented CD with canary verification, and migrated from ChatOps to fully automated deployments. We‚Äôll cover how we‚Äôre leveraging AI and our developer platform to manage change at scale, what tools we use, and which ones have added the most value.

-7:30PM - Kevin Godfrey, Director Product Eng -  Tackling the right tech debt at the right time. 
Description: A playbook for how to identify the *correct* engineering investments and tech debt to address as your product matures. A practical playbook on how to identify high value investment areas, scope, and deliver them, as well as practical guidance on how to connect business value to technical investment decisions.

-8:00PM - Wrap up cocktail hour and open Q&A - Opportunity to get face time with Super.com technology leadership to discuss a decision or challenge you are facing in your own org with one of the presenters.

properties.title: The Future of Digital Storytelling - Automating Creativity: Can Procedural Tech Power Inclusive Design?
properties.description:

This session dives into how procedural tools like SideFX‚Äôs Houdini, AI-generated content, and accessibility-forward design principles are changing the landscape for neurodivergent creators, immersive storytellers, and the future of inclusive entertainment.

properties.title: The Future of Digital Storytelling - High-Performance, Low Barrier: Making Creative Tech Accessible for All
properties.description:
Powerful computing is no longer the domain of large studios. With affordable AI-enabled hardware, creators at every level can now unlock real-time workflows and advanced capabilities once out of reach.

In this panel, leaders from AMD and swyvl explore how new generations of compute tech are breaking down economic and cognitive barriers‚Äîopening doors for independent creators, neurodivergent professionals, and small studios.

properties.title: The Future of Digital Storytelling - Beyond the Blockbuster: How VFX Workflows Can Power Real-World Storytelling
properties.description:
Virtual production, neural rendering, and AI-driven pipelines have transformed how blockbusters are made‚Äîbut their true potential goes far beyond the big screen.

This session explores how cutting-edge VFX workflows are being adapted for new impact-driven uses, from education and healthcare to inclusion and advocacy. Discover how tools originally designed for high-end film production can empower initiatives like swyvl to create immersive, accessible, and emotionally resonant experiences that support neurodivergent communities and beyond.

properties.title: Agentic RAG with Evaluations and MCP - Dan Dobrin
properties.description:
The Toronto Java User Group (TJUG) is a community-driven meetup for Java developers in the Toronto area. We host monthly events featuring expert talks, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities covering topics like modern Java frameworks, performance optimization, and best practices. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, TJUG provides a space to learn, share knowledge, and connect with fellow Java practitioners. Join the group to stay up to date with the latest in Java development and grow your skills in a collaborative environment.

Talk Details
Build more capable and reliable AI systems by combining context-aware retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) with agentic decision-making in an enterprise AI platform, all in Java! This session covers everything from architecture, context construction, and model routing to action planning, dynamic retrieval, and recursive reasoning, as well as the implementation of essential guardrails and monitoring systems for safe deployments. Learn about best practices, trade-offs, performance, and advanced techniques like evaluations and model context protocol.

About the venue
Free Times Cafe has bistro-style seating and a full food and drink menu. Please consider helping to support the venue by planning to have supper during the talk.

Presenter Info
Dan Dobrin is an App Architect in Google Cloud, helping customer teams adopt modern cloud-native patterns, practices and technologies. His focus is on GenAI, Vertex, Gemini, CodeAssist, Cloud Run, K8s, Native Java Images, Spring, Event-driven Architectures, Production-readiness and Performance Optimization.

Prior to joining Google Cloud, he has built highly scalable, low-latency, frameworks for technology, security and financial services organizations.

Recent conference talks: Google Cloud Next24, Spring I/O 2024 and Devoxx Belgium 2024

properties.description:
Visit the epicentre of AI innovation ‚Äî Toronto's Discovery District ‚Äî where modern artificial intelligence was crafted by Nobel Laureate Geoffrey Hinton and continues to evolve through world-leading research and commercialization. 

‚Äã‚ÄãJoin University Professor Emeritus and Nobel Prize winner, Geoffrey Hinton, for a candid conversation with Nick Frosst, Co-Founder of Cohere, on the opportunities, challenges, and obligations when building a new venture leveraging the power of artificial intelligence.

‚Äã‚ÄãArtificial intelligence adoption has quickly captured the public imagination and sparked important debates around the world. Governments, business leaders and global citizens are having critical conversations about whether and how AI should be regulated and what guardrails need to be in place to protect society. Advocates on both sides argue about both the enormous potential and risks of this disruptive technology. The rapid emergence of generative AI and large language models (LLMs) has accelerated this debate.

‚Äã‚ÄãThe fireside chat will cover a broad range of topics, including:

‚Äã‚Äã- Canada‚Äôs place in the AI revolution
- Do LLMs understand language in the same way as we do?
- Reasons for optimism
- ‚Äã‚ÄãRisks of AI
- Is digital intelligence better than analog intelligence?

‚ÄãFrontiers of AI is a day of programming on June 25 delivered in partnership with the University of Toronto (U of T), MaRS and The Vector Institute, featuring a hands-on showcase of Canadian innovation that is shaping the global future of AI ‚Äî take part in engaging conversations, demos, workshops and networking. Meet emerging and established leaders in AI, alongside decision-makers in business and tech.

‚Äã‚ÄãLocated in the heart of Toronto's innovation corridor, this event brings together three powerhouse institutions that have helped establish Toronto as a world-leading AI hub: MaRS, the world's largest urban innovation hubs; the University of Toronto, home to pioneering AI breakthroughs that sparked the global AI revolution and The Vector Institute, renowned for bridging cutting-edge AI research with real-world applications across 32 enterprise partners and 200+ startups.

‚ÄãThis event is open to:

‚Äã‚Äã- Founders and entrepreneurs in AI and deep tech
- Corporate innovation leaders and investors
- AI researchers and practitioners
- Students and professionals interested in AI careers
- Industry partners seeking AI collaboration opportunities

‚ÄãRegistration is required due to limited capacity.

properties.title: Powering the Electric Mind: Culture, Wellbeing & Mindfulness in Tech
properties.description:
Real innovation starts with people. Powering the Electric Mind is a spirited conversation about how we can reshape the future of work by putting culture, wellbeing, and mindfulness at the heart of everything we do.

‚Äã‚ÄãJoin our expert panelists as they share real-world insights on what it takes to build workplaces where creativity soars, people feel seen, and teams achieve lasting success. This isn‚Äôt about perks and buzz words, it‚Äôs about finding purpose, making connections, and building a culture that inspires from the inside out. 

‚Äã‚ÄãWhether you're a founder, leader, HR professional, or a technologist passionate about better work environments, this event will inspire you to help lead meaningful change in your organization.

‚Äã‚ÄãSome of the topics we‚Äôll touch on:
‚Äã‚Äã*Leading with empathy, authenticity, and impact
‚Äã‚Äã*Leveraging mindfulness to combat burnout and boost creativity
‚Äã‚Äã*Finding focus in busy tech environments
*‚Äã‚ÄãFostering a corporate culture that connects
*‚Äã‚ÄãAI as a positive change agent in corporate culture

‚Äã‚ÄãDon‚Äôt miss this opportunity to connect with forward-thinking peers and gain new tools to shape the future of work in tech. The future is bright!
